explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 forbids modifying function parameters. In this function the parameter length is mutated (length -= SHA256_BLOCK_SIZE; and length -= bytes_left;) which violates the rule. Additionally, the pointer parameter data is incremented (data += bytes_left; data += SHA256_BLOCK_SIZE;), which also violates the rule because the pointer parameter itself is being modified. The proper remedy is to make local copies (e.g. size_t len = length; const uint8_t *p = data;) and update those local variables instead.
